intro: Staurogyne malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca starwort, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of tropical flora.
